  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(ClientImpl client, Server server)
      The start method initializes and starts the game by setting up the client and server, handling user input, and controlling the game flow.
      Specified by:
      start in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      client - : an instance of the ClientImpl class representing the client for the game.
      server - : an instance of the Server class representing the server for the game.

    • inputHandler

      public void inputHandler(String input)
      The inputHandler method is responsible for handling user input during different states of the game. It processes the input and performs the corresponding actions based on the current state.
      Parameters:
      input - : the user's input.

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname(String nickname)
      This method is responsible for setting the nickname of the viewing player in the game. It checks if 'nickname' is made of alphanumerical characters and updates the viewingPlayerNickname field accordingly. It also notifies the server of the nickname change.
      Specified by:
      setNickname in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      nickname - : a String representing the nickname to be set for the viewing player.

    • getPlayerChoice

      public void getPlayerChoice(boolean yourTurn, String menuChoice)
      This method handles the player's menu choice.
      Specified by:
      getPlayerChoice in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      yourTurn - : a boolean value indicating whether it is the player's turn. If true lets the player pick the tiles from the livingRoom
      menuChoice - : menu choice made by the player.

    • receiveMessages

      public void receiveMessages(List<Message> messages)
      Adds all the new chat messages in this.chatMessages.
      Specified by:
      receiveMessages in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      messages - : list of Message.

    • updatedPlayerList

      public void updatedPlayerList(List<String> players)
      The updatedPlayerList method is called when the player list is updated, either due to players joining or leaving the game. It compares the updated player list with the previous player list to determine if any players have disconnected or reconnected. It also updates the offline player list and displays relevant notifications to the player.
      Specified by:
      updatedPlayerList in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      players -

    • updateGame

      public void updateGame(GameUpdate update)
      The updateGame method is called when a game update is received from the server. It updates the game state, including the living room, player information, common goal cards, current player, and game ender. It also handles notifications, updates the CLI interface, and triggers state changes if necessary.
      Specified by:
      updateGame in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      update - : a GameUpdate object containing the updated game information.

    • serverError

      public void serverError(String message)
      The serverError method is called to display an error message received from the server. It prints the error message in red color to the console.
      Specified by:
      serverError in interface ViewController
      Parameters:
      message - : A String representing the error message received from the server.

    • askNumPlayers

      public void askNumPlayers()
      It displays a message asking the user to enter the number of players within a specified range.
      Specified by:
      askNumPlayers in interface ViewController

    • setNumPlayers

      public void setNumPlayers(String input) throws RemoteException
      This method is called to set the number of players in the game based on the user's input and updates the server.
      Parameters:
      input - : a String> representing the user's input for the number of players.
      Throws:
      RemoteException

    • calculateCommonGoalCardPoints

      public Map<String,Integer> calculateCommonGoalCardPoints(int cardID)
      It calculates the points earned by each player for a specific common goal card.
      Parameters:
      cardID - : represents the ID of the CommonGoalCard for which the points are to be calculated.
      Returns:
      a map where for each player's nickname there's the corresponding points for this specific CommonGoalCard.

    • calculatePersonalGoalCardPoints

      public int calculatePersonalGoalCardPoints()
      Calculates viewingPlayer's PersonalGoalCard points.
      Returns:
      total points of the viewingPlayer's PersonalGoalCard.

    • calculatePersonalGoalCardPoints

      public int calculatePersonalGoalCardPoints(String playerNickname)
      Calculates playerNickname's PersonalGoalCard points.
      Parameters:
      playerNickname - : a String representing the player's nickname
      Returns:
      total points of playerNickname's PersonalGoalCard.

    • returnTiles

      public void returnTiles(List<Coordinates> coordinates, int column)
      This method is responsible for handling the action of a player picking the tiles from LivingRoom in a game. It takes a list of coordinates representing the tiles to be returned and an integer column indicating the column where the tiles should be placed
      Parameters:
      coordinates - : a list of coordinates indicating the tiles chosen in the board.
      column - : an integer indicating the column where the returned tiles should be placed in the bookshelf.

    • showEndingScreen

      public void showEndingScreen()
      This method show the final ending screen, with the scoreboard and the winner. If the viewingPlayer is the last online player, he is automatically the winner.
      Specified by:
      showEndingScreen in interface ViewController
